solution_line_template: Rhea buys a total of {eggs_per_tray} x {trays_per_week} = <<{eggs_per_tray}*{trays_per_week}={total_eggs_bought_per_week}>>{total_eggs_bought_per_week} eggs every week.

Her son and daughter eat {son_daughter_eggs_per_morning} x {days_per_week} = <<{son_daughter_eggs_per_morning}*{days_per_week}={son_daughter_eggs_eaten_per_week}>>{son_daughter_eggs_eaten_per_week} eggs every week.

Rhea and her husband eat {rhea_husband_eggs_per_night} x {days_per_week}= <<{rhea_husband_eggs_per_night}*{days_per_week}={rhea_husband_eggs_eaten_per_week}>>{rhea_husband_eggs_eaten_per_week} eggs every week.

So, the total eggs they eat is {rhea_husband_eggs_eaten_per_week} + {son_daughter_eggs_eaten_per_week} = <<{rhea_husband_eggs_eaten_per_week}+{son_daughter_eggs_eaten_per_week}={total_eggs_eaten_per_week}>>{total_eggs_eaten_per_week}.

Therefore, the total number of eggs that are not being eaten is {total_eggs_bought_per_week} - {total_eggs_eaten_per_week} = <<{total_eggs_bought_per_week}-{total_eggs_eaten_per_week}={eggs_not_eaten}>>{eggs_not_eaten}.
